commit_message:
OOQ/OVB: Add configurations for tempest job

This change is about replacing current tempest job with a one using
quickstart, proposed in https://review.openstack.org/420647.
We specify a new name and job type containing "oooq" so quickstart
script will be activated, and inside this script we're checking if the
TOCI_JOBTYPE contains the pattern to trigger tempest.
We are changing the test to apply on nonha deployments instead of HA,
and setting the ansible variables accordingly.
The configuration tested locally for a successful full tempest run use
the minimal_pacemaker quickstart configuration, but overriding the
variables that activate the ping test and set the variables that
activate tempest test. Cinder-backup service is not enable by default
and we are enabling to make some tests pass.i
We're going to run the full list of tests, with some exceptions added to
the skip list.

Change-Id: I3084e020e6997efd804306b3350dc9752cda549e

commit_message:
Fix: swarm cluster-config, bay-config with tls_disabled

magnum cluster-config, bay-config for swarm cluster
didn't work with tls_disabled.

With this patch following is done:-
if tls_disabled then set DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY=""
if not tls_disabled then set DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY=True

Change-Id: I57eb1d49b5157958f9c5f6d89a613896300fdb6e
Closes-Bug: #1647254

commit_message:
Set memcached server to local one for non-keyston services

We misconfigured local cache for services with change
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/Id1034e22d79c3ea6b25575d9bcf8e8750a02365d
Thus, it becomes extremely slow when a controller is down.

With this commit we revert things back to normal with local memcached
for all openstack services leaving keystone memcached shared for tokens
(this was thoroughly tested previously)

Change-Id: I8f6bbf77d27f3d8976985241deb8a948984862f5
Closes-bug: #1657727

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 14:22:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/ovs_ryuapp.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a1ca8ee5a1cca549cd294295a6af2a396b9b3957', 'message': 'ovs-agent: Catch exceptions in agent_main_wrapper

When of_interface=native, the ovs agent code is run as a ryuapp thread,
which means it must be properly shut down or the process fails to
terminate.  Catch exceptions and make sure that the agent terminates,
even if in unlucky cases.

Change-Id: I7aebeaa00e2416a275d9ecd940eb28c819349656
Closes-Bug: #1611237
(cherry picked from commit 3e45c19eedccd800d7c6e5f0fce57295cf3a7b02)
'}]
commit_message:
ovs-agent: Catch exceptions in agent_main_wrapper

When of_interface=native, the ovs agent code is run as a ryuapp thread,
which means it must be properly shut down or the process fails to
terminate.  Catch exceptions and make sure that the agent terminates,
even if in unlucky cases.

Change-Id: I7aebeaa00e2416a275d9ecd940eb28c819349656
Closes-Bug: #1611237
(cherry picked from commit 3e45c19eedccd800d7c6e5f0fce57295cf3a7b02)

commit_message:
Remove PKI signing related parameters

PKI token support has been deprecated in the M release and will be
removed in the O release.
Deprecate cache_dir parameter.

Change-Id: Id25142d2bd07cd239e5eb5112d65f4e0d9299bc2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/84/415384/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'<SERVICE DEFAULT>', 'signing_cert_subject' => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', 'signing_key_size' => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', 'enable_pki_setup' => true, 'signing_certfile' => '/C=US/ST=Unset/L=Unset/O=Unset/CN=www.example.com', 'signing_key_size' => 2048, 'keystone_user' => 'keystone', 'keystone_group' => 'keystone', } end it { is_expected.to --keystone-group #{params['keystone_group']}", :creates => '/etc/keystone/ssl/private/signing_key.pem' ) } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/var/cache/keystone').with_ensure('directory') } describe contain_keystone_config('signing/cert_subject').with_value('signing_cert_subject') end it 'should contain correct PKI key_size config' do is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('signing/keyfile').with_value('signing_keyfile') end it 'should contain correct PKI ca_certs config' do is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('signing/ca_certs').with_value('signing_ca_certs') end it 'should contain correct PKI ca_key config' do is_expected.to :catalog_driver => 'alien' } end it { is_expected.to contain_keystone_config('catalog/driver').with_value(params[:catalog_driver]) } end end

commit_message:
Adds 'fast8'. A quicker pep8 checker

This adds a new tox rule 'fast8' and script to check pep8
in the last commited files. Not that tempest pep8 is that slow
as in other projects for example, but this came to be very
handy adding in git-review/git-commit hooks and might save
a lot of time.

Change-Id: I9b2b22eeb999223b0428f0f57e7119571e855f7f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/423242/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:fast8] # Use same environment directory as pep8 env to save space and install time envdir = {toxworkdir}/pep8 commands = {toxinidir}/tools/fast8.sh

commit_message:
Allow definition of repo filename

If a deployer wants to co-locate his rabbitmq mirror with another
content in the same repo, (s)he probably also wants to define the same
repo filename, to avoid clashes.

This commit brings this feature optionally, and follows the same
pattern as other roles.

Change-Id: Id4d2198eebf05a8dc48949e4a129491c75037c79
(cherry picked from commit 4dd1ca8a2963dddaac753ebca25584fc05647951)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/25/423225/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove support for py33/py26

Python 3.3/Python 2.6 is not supported from Mitaka, as per Infra.
This patch removes the support for the same.

commit_message:
Add new swarm test for cinder multi backend

Add test for check deployment cinder multi backend:
block device driver + lvm.

Change-Id: I0a74bd78d9b286234764b7af9cd62bd6cda51147
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/30/366630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_3], groups=["deploy_bdd_and_lvm"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def bdd_lvm_ha_one_controller_compact(self): """Deploy cluster with Cinder multi backend(bdd+lvm) Scenario: 1. Create cluster with Neutron vlan 2. Add 1 nodes with controller and cinder vlm node 3. Add 1 nodes with compute and cinder-block-device role 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Network check 6. Run OSTF tests Duration 60m Snapshot bdd_lvm_ha_one_controller_compact """ self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_3_slaves") self.show_step(1) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, settings={ 'tenant': 'bdd', 'user': 'bdd', 'password': 'bdd', 'volumes_lvm': True, 'volumes_ceph': False, 'images_ceph': False, 'objects_ceph': False, 'ephemeral_ceph': False, 'nova_quotas': True, 'volumes_block_device': True, 'net_provider': 'neutron', 'net_segment_type': settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT['vlan'], 'configure_ssl': False } ) self.show_step(2) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['controller', 'cinder'], 'slave-02': ['compute', 'cinder-block-device'], } ) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot("bdd_lvm_ha_one_controller_compact")

commit_message:
Cinder backup restore to an existing volume test

Cinder allow to restore backup with param 'volume_id'.
Create new test for check restoring backup to
existing volume.

Change-Id: Ic4a5846da17c72d417bc8f7a6a6e88571b83274b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/88/355388/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_backup_create_and_restore_to_an_existing_volume(self): """Test backup create and restore to an existing volume. Cinder allow to restore backup to to an existing volume""" # Create backup backup_name = data_utils.rand_name('Backup') backup = self.backups_client.create_backup( volume_id=self.volume['id'], name=backup_name, force=True)['backup'] self.addCleanup(self.backups_client.delete_backup, backup['id']) self.backups_client.wait_for_backup_status(backup['id'], 'available') # Restore to existing volume restore = self.backups_client.restore_backup( backup_id=backup['id'], volume_id=self.volume['id'])['restore'] self.backups_client.wait_for_backup_status(backup['id'], 'available') waiters.wait_for_volume_status( self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'available') self.assertEqual(self.volume['id'], restore['volume_id'])

commit_message:
Create backup from snapshot

Cinder allows create backup from snapshot.
We need new test to cover this feature.

Add functions create_backup and clear_backups to
class BaseVolumeTest.
Add backups list to resource_setup and resource_cleanup.

Change-Id: I1964ce6e1298041f8238d76fa4b7029d2d23bbfb

added_lines: @test.idempotent_id('885410c6-cd1d-452c-a409-7c32b7e0be15') def test_volume_snapshot_backup(self): """create backup from snapshot""" # Create snapshot snapshot = self.create_snapshot(self.volume['id']) self.addCleanup(self.snapshots_client.delete_snapshot, snapshot['id']) # Create backup backup_name = data_utils.rand_name('Backup') backup = self.admin_backups_client.create_backup( name=backup_name, volume_id=self.volume['id'], snapshot_id=snapshot['id'])['backup'] self.addCleanup(self._delete_backup, backup['id']) self.admin_backups_client.wait_for_backup_status(backup['id'], 'available') # Get a given backup backup = self.admin_backups_client.show_backup(backup['id'])['backup'] self.assertEqual(backup['snapshot_id'], snapshot['id'])

commit_message:
force en_US.UTF-8 during devstack runs

devstack was defaulting to C locale to avoid parsing issues with a
number of bash commands. However, as it starts all the services under
that locale it actually means we're not really running in a unicoded
enabled service environment. That masks a number of issues.

We should stop doing that, and force that we're in a known utf8
environment for command parsing.

Change-Id: Ie121a8ebf8d5d8ddd75eb1688be7a91893a8eba6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/32/370132/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Force en_US.UTF-8 for all runs. If we don't have a utf8 environment # then we actually won't test many utf8 features in OpenStack, which # is a problem. However, we grep command output enough that we need a # known fixed language otherwise things like ip return strings we # don't understand. Yes, this means we're forcing everyone on devstack # to an english locale. Not completely ideal, but the best compromise # right now. export LANG=en_US.UTF-8 # set this for future runs # Ubuntu if [[ -e /etc/default/locale ]]; then echo 'LANG="en_US.UTF-8"' | sudo tee /etc/default/locale fi
deleted_lines: # Sanitize language settings to avoid commands bailing out # with "unsupported locale setting" errors. unset LANG unset LANGUAGE LC_ALL=C export LC_ALL

commit_message:
reduce exposure to http image issues

This changes the default value of CONF.image.http_image to '', skips
the 2 tests that require http_image if it is not set, and retools the
3 test which really doesn't need the http_image to not use it.

That allows enabling / disabling these test by just setting or not
that value in your tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I86e4556d3fca837eb67abb358781d6d09c7b7b1b

commit_message:
introduce default project branch concept

Every time we need to cut a new stable/ branch for devstack, there is
a bit of confusion which projects should actually get a stable/
branch. This consolidates it into a single variable to make the
transition easier.

Change-Id: I483a60cc48781332796599c281abb2ea4b2d06cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/51/376451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The default branch for projects which also have stable/ # branches. Makes transitioning to stable much more straight forward. DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH="master" CINDER_BRANCH=${CINDER_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}GLANCE_BRANCH=${GLANCE_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}HEAT_BRANCH=${HEAT_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}HORIZON_BRANCH=${HORIZON_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}KEYSTONE_BRANCH=${KEYSTONE_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}NEUTRON_BRANCH=${NEUTRON_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}NEUTRON_FWAAS_BRANCH=${NEUTRON_FWAAS_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}NOVA_BRANCH=${NOVA_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}SWIFT_BRANCH=${SWIFT_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}REQUIREMENTS_BRANCH=${REQUIREMENTS_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}GITBRANCH["neutron-lib"]=${NEUTRON_LIB_BRANCH:-$DEFAULT_PROJECT_BRANCH}

commit_message:
Be more specific about placement api warnings

The non use of the placement api is basically deprecated in Newton,
our previous errors stated that this was something that was optional
in Newton, which is really only half true. You have to stand this up
and put this into your service catalog before Ocata.

This attempts to act more like the deprecation that it is.

Change-Id: I8b2e2492a39d5e95ddb42a49663d17422e77c774
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/369490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: PLACEMENT_WARNING = """ Optional use of placement API for reporting is now disabled. NOTE: The placement api must be enabled and running *prior* to upgrading to Ocata. Please see install guide for details. """ ENDPOINT_NOT_FOUND_WARNING = ( "The placement API endpoint not found." + PLACEMENT_WARNING ) PLACEMENT_AUTH_WARNING = ( "No authentication information found for placement API." + PLACEMENT_WARNING ) msg = _LW(ENDPOINT_NOT_FOUND_WARNING) # noqa msg = _LW(PLACEMENT_AUTH_WARNING) # noqa
deleted_lines: msg = _LW("The placement API endpoint not found. Optional use of " "placement API for reporting is now disabled.") msg = _LW("No authentication information found for placement API. " "Optional use of placement API for reporting is now " "disabled.")

commit_message:
Allow override of the repo filename

Apt cannot have 2 mirrors with the same content in 2 different files.
This commit makes possible to decide the filename for the repo to
avoid possible clashes.

Change-Id: I8be9b49e40b755cb90928067c60fe8a5d9c5ae0b

commit_message:
Allow override of the repo filename

Apt cannot have 2 mirrors with the same content in 2 different files.
If a deployer has an apt mirror with uca, the deployer
still need to add a repository, but will also need to define the
filename used, in order to avoid clashes.

This commit makes possible to decide the filename for the repo, and
has no master conterpart, because the PPA is only used in Trusty.

Change-Id: Ic6bf8435b06dd866d0c8b984bdbaa7b5fff75e1b

commit_message:
indexer: fix datetime with mysql >= 5.7.17

The upgrade script 5c4f93e5bb4_mysql_float_to_timestamp haven't set
a default for new datetime column make upgrade on mysql >= 5.7.17 to
fail. This set a server default for datetime columns.

Change-Id: I8bd16eaa202e8e63ff38baa0ff00c20e4c639148
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/90/423090/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-12 09:41:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/9e73f7d29f979ad0993a097d781993386ab0d113', 'message': "Normalize parameters

This change introduces parameters normalization, when a nested
resources tree from getParameters arrives, the tree is normalized
into a flat list of resources and parameters. Parameters are uniquely
identified by name and resources get an uuid generated.

Parameter and Services lists are constructed using selectors.

This change allows to sanely store resource tree in application state,
make any imaginable selections on a subtree or listing certain
parameters. In addition, we're able to do optimistic updates on
parameter values in application state.

Parameters and Resources are ordered alphabetically, Service names are
truncated to pure service name rather than using resource type name,
Internal parameters are filtered.

A list of warnings about colliding parameter properties currently
appear during normalization. This is a side effect of a bug
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640243) in tripleo-heat-
templates

Partial-Bug: 1642216
Implements: blueprint deployment-configuration-improvements
Change-Id: I2d4d78b0abc45718df584f7571feb0c2fb30941b

commit_message:
Normalize parameters

This change introduces parameters normalization, when a nested
resources tree from getParameters arrives, the tree is normalized
into a flat list of resources and parameters. Parameters are uniquely
identified by name and resources get an uuid generated.

Parameter and Services lists are constructed using selectors.

This change allows to sanely store resource tree in application state,
make any imaginable selections on a subtree or listing certain
parameters. In addition, we're able to do optimistic updates on
parameter values in application state.

Parameters and Resources are ordered alphabetically, Service names are
truncated to pure service name rather than using resource type name,
Internal parameters are filtered.

A list of warnings about colliding parameter properties currently
appear during normalization. This is a side effect of a bug
(https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1640243) in tripleo-heat-
templates

Partial-Bug: 1642216
Implements: blueprint deployment-configuration-improvements
Change-Id: I2d4d78b0abc45718df584f7571feb0c2fb30941b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/22/403422/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import { normalize } from 'normalizr';import uuid from 'node-uuid'; import * as _ from 'lodash';import { resourceGroupSchema } from '../normalizrSchemas/parameters'; const { resources, parameters } = _normalizeParameters(resourceTree); debugger; dispatch(this.fetchParametersSuccess({ resources, parameters, mistralParameters })); const _normalizeParameters = resourceTree => { resourceTree.name = 'Root'; return normalize(_processResource(resourceTree), resourceGroupSchema).entities || {}; }; // Recursively convert NestedParameters and Parameters objects to Arrays // so the data structure is easily consumable by normalizr const _processResource = resource => { resource.id = uuid.v4(); if (resource.NestedParameters) { resource.NestedParameters = // Convert NestedParameters (Resources) object to Array _.values( // Set NestedParameter (Resource) object key as NestedParameter name property _.mapValues(resource.NestedParameters, (value, key) => { value.name = key; // Recursively process nested Resources return _processResource(value); }) ); } if (resource.Parameters) { resource.Parameters = // Convert Parameters object to Array _.values( // Set Parameter object key as Parameter name property _.mapValues(resource.Parameters, (value, key) => { value.name = key; // Convert Parameter properties to camelCase return _.mapKeys(value, (value, key) => _.camelCase(key)); }) ); } // Convert Resource properties to camelCase return _.mapKeys(resource, (value, key) => _.camelCase(key)); };

https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/blob/master/HISTORY.rst

So we should work correctly with both old and new psutil

commit_message:
Adjust test suite for new psutil versions

psutil 2.x and above has a lot of API changes as described in:
https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/blob/master/HISTORY.rst

So we should work correctly with both old and new psutil
versions by using a version check and use the correct
method/attributes. This allows to eventually unlift the version
cap that starts to hurt.

Change-Id: I6b6682e3af34f43da4e397d602e9ee4e1c83970f
Related-Bug: 1645918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-refresh-config refs/changes/80/422180/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # psutils version >= 2 children = list(p.children(recursive=True)) except AttributeError: children = list(p.get_children(recursive=True))

commit_message:
Preserve backwards compat for expand_dependencies

This was a public interface so we should try and preserve backwards
compat. We can do so trivially by making the old method be a shim for
calling a new method by the name of expand_elelement_dependencies.

Change-Id: I15609389c18adf3017220fc94552514d195b323a

Fix same type of simple message error

Sometimes messages are missing or adding white spaces, now traverse
the same type of error and modify it.

commit_message:
Add new feature to consume external images

For certain types of tests, it is needed to consume external
overcloud and agent images. Using settings already in place, such
as the images and inject_images settings, we can achieve it just
by using a new use_external_images setting.

Change-Id: If57a055ca74f0e3e868e3ecb1809b65443b42359

commit_message:
Sync setup_multipath setup part with base Fuel setup workflow

For some reasons multipath test is failing getting releases
without the check before it. Put it and make multipath test
closer to all other cases.

Change-Id: I73bfda7e2b4469214b86b9150967bfe249281da2
Partial-bug:1656872

added_lines: def make_query(trait_query=None, **kwargs): if key == 'trait_type':def deserialize_entry(entry): """Return a list of flatten_result for k, v in entry.items(): if ':' in k[2:]: key = tuple([unquote(i) for i in k[2:].split(':')]) else: key = unquote(k[2:]) flatten_result[key] = load(v) return flatten_result return {'f:' + quote(k, ':'): dump(v) for k, v in entry_dict.items()}
deleted_lines: from panko import utilsdef _QualifierFilter(op, qualifier): return "QualifierFilter (%s, 'binaryprefix:m_%s')" % (op, qualifier) def make_query(metaquery=None, trait_query=None, **kwargs): :param metaquery: optional metaquery dict if key == 'source': q.append("SingleColumnValueFilter " "('f', 's_%s', =, 'binary:%s', true, true)" % (value, dump('1'))) elif key == 'trait_type': if metaquery: meta_q = [] for k, v in metaquery.items(): meta_q.append( "SingleColumnValueFilter ('f', '%s', =, 'binary:%s', " "true, true)" % ('r_' + k, dump(v))) meta_q = " AND ".join(meta_q) # join query and metaquery if res_q is not None: res_q += " AND " + meta_q else: res_q = meta_q # metaquery only def deserialize_entry(entry, get_raw_meta=True): """Return a list of flatten_result, sources, meters and metadata. sources/meters are the lists of sources and meters correspondingly. metadata is metadata dict. This dict may be returned as flattened if get_raw_meta is False. :param get_raw_meta: If true then raw metadata will be returned, if False metadata will be constructed from 'f:r_metadata.' fields sources = [] meters = [] metadata_flattened = {} for k, v in entry.items(): if k.startswith('f:s_'): sources.append(decode_unicode(k[4:])) elif k.startswith('f:r_metadata.'): qualifier = decode_unicode(k[len('f:r_metadata.'):]) metadata_flattened[qualifier] = load(v) elif k.startswith("f:m_"): meter = ([unquote(i) for i in k[4:].split(':')], load(v)) meters.append(meter) else: if ':' in k[2:]: key = tuple([unquote(i) for i in k[2:].split(':')]) else: key = unquote(k[2:]) flatten_result[key] = load(v) if get_raw_meta: metadata = flatten_result.get('resource_metadata', {}) else: metadata = metadata_flattened return flatten_result, meters, metadata result = {} for k, v in entry_dict.items(): if k == 'source': # user, project and resource tables may contain several sources. # Besides, resource table may contain several meters. # To make insertion safe we need to store all meters and sources in # a separate cell. For this purpose s_ and m_ prefixes are # introduced. qualifier = encode_unicode('f:s_%s' % v) result[qualifier] = dump('1') elif k == 'meter': for meter, ts in v.items(): qualifier = encode_unicode('f:m_%s' % meter) result[qualifier] = dump(ts) elif k == 'resource_metadata': # keep raw metadata as well as flattened to provide # capability with API v2. It will be flattened in another # way on API level. But we need flattened too for quick filtering. flattened_meta = dump_metadata(v) for key, m in flattened_meta.items(): metadata_qualifier = encode_unicode('f:r_metadata.' + key) result[metadata_qualifier] = dump(m) result['f:resource_metadata'] = dump(v) else: result['f:' + quote(k, ':')] = dump(v) return result def dump_metadata(meta): resource_metadata = {} for key, v in utils.dict_to_keyval(meta): resource_metadata[key] = v return resource_metadatadef encode_unicode(data): return data.encode('utf-8') if isinstance(data, six.text_type) else data def decode_unicode(data): return data.decode('utf-8') if isinstance(data, six.string_types) else data

commit_message:
Add wait before sending version request

We check fuel version via api
but when we send request fuel is
not ready. Need to add wait for fuel

Partial-bug:1657695
Change-Id: I82bb920ebf7ec84b3015b6afa6125d4b1d8fb960

commit_message:
Fullstack SG test for LinuxBridge agent

This patch adds fullstack test for LinuxBridge L2
agent with iptables firewall driver.
As LinuxBridge L2 agent tests are spawning each agent
in separate namespace it is possible to test security
groups functionality.

Change-Id: I755c2f1cf68acc0df110902f3a587040ed0a4bab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/417532/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.tenant_uuid = uuidutils.generate_uuid() self.network = self.safe_client.create_network(self.tenant_uuid) self.safe_client.create_subnet( self.tenant_uuid, self.network['id'], '20.0.0.0/24') self.sgs = [self.safe_client.create_security_group(self.tenant_uuid) for i in range(2)] def _test_tcp_securitygroup(self, index_to_sg, index_to_host): """Tests if a TCP security group rule is working, by confirming that 1. connection from allowed security group is allowed, 2. connection from elsewhere is blocked, 3. traffic not explicitly allowed (eg. ICMP) is blocked, 4. a security group update takes effect, 5. a remote security group member addition works, and 6. an established connection stops by deleting a SG rule. """ self.ports = [ self.safe_client.create_port(self.tenant_uuid, self.network['id'], self.environment.hosts[host].hostname, security_groups=[self.sgs[sg]['id']]) for host, sg in zip(index_to_host, index_to_sg)] self.safe_client.create_security_group_rule( self.tenant_uuid, self.sgs[0]['id'], remote_group_id=self.sgs[0]['id'], direction='ingress', ethertype=constants.IPv4, protocol=constants.PROTO_NAME_TCP, port_range_min=3333, port_range_max=3333) self.vms = [ self.useFixture( machine.FakeFullstackMachine( self.environment.hosts[host], self.network['id'], self.tenant_uuid, self.safe_client, neutron_port=self.ports[port])) for port, host in enumerate(index_to_host)] for vm in self.vms: vm.block_until_boot() # 1. check if connection from allowed security group is allowed self.assert_connection( self.vms[1].namespace, self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[0].ip, 3333, net_helpers.NetcatTester.TCP) # 2. check if connection from elsewhere is blocked self.assert_no_connection( self.vms[2].namespace, self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[0].ip, 3333, net_helpers.NetcatTester.TCP) # 3. check if traffic not explicitly allowed (eg. ICMP) is blocked net_helpers.assert_no_ping(self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[1].ip) net_helpers.assert_no_ping(self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[2].ip) net_helpers.assert_no_ping(self.vms[1].namespace, self.vms[2].ip) # 4. check if a security group update takes effect self.assert_no_connection( self.vms[1].namespace, self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[0].ip, 3344, net_helpers.NetcatTester.TCP) self.safe_client.create_security_group_rule( self.tenant_uuid, self.sgs[0]['id'], remote_group_id=self.sgs[0]['id'], direction='ingress', ethertype=constants.IPv4, protocol=constants.PROTO_NAME_TCP, port_range_min=3344, port_range_max=3344) self.assert_connection( self.vms[1].namespace, self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[0].ip, 3344, net_helpers.NetcatTester.TCP) # 5. check if a remote security group member addition works self.sg_rule = self.safe_client.create_security_group_rule( self.tenant_uuid, self.sgs[0]['id'], remote_group_id=self.sgs[1]['id'], direction='ingress', ethertype=constants.IPv4, protocol=constants.PROTO_NAME_TCP, port_range_min=3355, port_range_max=3355) self.assert_connection( self.vms[2].namespace, self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[0].ip, 3355, net_helpers.NetcatTester.TCP) def _test_break_established_connection(self, host): """This test can't be performed with iptables firewall driver In firewall driver based on iptables established connections are (by design) always accepted before checking all other rules so this test will always fail in such casse. """ self.ports.append( self.safe_client.create_port(self.tenant_uuid, self.network['id'], self.environment.hosts[host].hostname, security_groups=[self.sgs[1]['id']])) self.vms.append( self.useFixture( machine.FakeFullstackMachine( self.environment.hosts[host], self.network['id'], self.tenant_uuid, self.safe_client, neutron_port=self.ports[3]))) self.vms[3].block_until_boot() netcat = net_helpers.NetcatTester(self.vms[3].namespace, self.vms[0].namespace, self.vms[0].ip, 3355, net_helpers.NetcatTester.TCP) self.addCleanup(netcat.stop_processes) self.assertTrue(netcat.test_connectivity()) # 6. check if an established connection stops by deleting # the supporting SG rule. self.client.delete_security_group_rule(self.sg_rule['id']) common_utils.wait_until_true(lambda: netcat.test_no_connectivity(), sleep=8) netcat.stop_processes() class TestOvsSecurityGroupsSameNetwork(BaseSecurityGroupsSameNetworkTest): self._test_tcp_securitygroup(index_to_sg, index_to_host) self._test_break_established_connection(index_to_host[2]) class TestLinuxBridgeSecurityGroupsSameNetwork( BaseSecurityGroupsSameNetworkTest): l2_agent_type = constants.AGENT_TYPE_LINUXBRIDGE network_type = 'vxlan' firewall_driver = "iptables" def test_tcp_securitygroup(self): index_to_sg = [0, 0, 1] index_to_host = [0, 1, 1] self._test_tcp_securitygroup(index_to_sg, index_to_host)

commit_message:
Allow blank rabbit password if using transport_url

rabbit_password was deprecated as part of
Idb4b53f7149d8867f92e5053b6557cd1f1a4b24f and transport_url should be
used instead. However if you use transport_url, it would fail if you
did not also provide the rabbit_password. We should not fail for a blank
rabbit_password if transport_url is used.

Change-Id: I00d4782693c1f67b82673624d4d36822c9762303

commit_message:
agent: always print the extension name on failure

This change always print the exception name on failure
and also print the backtrace if debug is enabled.

Change-Id: I69c1b81bd1cea8c8cdaba492661d2c2b7248ee92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/67/423167/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import logging show_exception = (LOG.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG) and isinstance(exc, ImportError)) LOG.error(_LE("Failed to import extension for %(name)r: " "%(error)s"), {'name': ep.name, 'error': exc}, exc_info=show_exception) if isinstance(exc, ImportError):
deleted_lines: if isinstance(exc, ImportError): LOG.error(_LE("Failed to import extension for %(name)s: " "%(error)s"), {'name': ep.name, 'error': exc})

When creating a volume from image, and then restarting
the cinder-volume process while the image is downloading,
cinder can't clean up the image tmp file under image
conversion dir.

This patch will add cleaning up in init_host,
covering 'downloading' and 'deleting' stats.
If user make force-delete on downloading volume and then
restart the cinder-volume, we still should ensure the tmp
file been cleaned after deleting this volume.

Closes-Bug: #1497088

commit_message:
Clean up image tmp file if c-vol gets restarted

When creating a volume from image, and then restarting
the cinder-volume process while the image is downloading,
cinder can't clean up the image tmp file under image
conversion dir.

This patch will clear all tmp files in init_host.

Change-Id: I58cf7c234e6d92c54ae3523a81bf4aefee039daf
Closes-Bug: #1497088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/81/225081/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def cleanup_temporary_file(volume_id): if (CONF.image_conversion_dir and not os.path.exists(CONF.image_conversion_dir)): return conf_dir = CONF.image_conversion_dir temp_dir = conf_dir if conf_dir else tempfile.gettempdir() files = os.listdir(path=temp_dir) for file in files: if volume_id in file: os.remove(file) break def fetch(cls, image_service, context, image_id, volume_id=''): with temporary_file(prefix='tmp'+volume_id) as tmp:
deleted_lines: def fetch(cls, image_service, context, image_id): with temporary_file() as tmp:

logs: add keystone-resources for debug

It can be useful to have keystone resources in a file, when Keystone has
been run.

commit_message:
Remove enable_(mistral|zaqar) options

Disabling either of these features is going to result in a useless
undercloud now, so there's no point exposing them as options.

Change-Id: I2c54ec066fcc321fefe473038631efe9ced61936

We can now query for flavors.

commit_message:
Mark Huawei volume driver as unsupported

The Huawei CI has not reported past our CI requirements.

Checking name: Huawei FusionStorage CI
last seen: 2016-09-30 08:36:22 (77 days, 8:53:56 old)
last success: 2016-09-30 08:36:22 (77 days, 8:51:53 old)
success rate: 54%

Per Cinder's non-compliance policy [1] this patch marks the driver
as unsupported and deprecated and it will be approved if the issue
is not corrected by the next cycle.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Cinder/tested-3rdParty-drivers#Non-Compliance_Policy

subject: Migration scenario, SR-IOV vif contains source physical ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 14:29:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/d386548c38485e0e9eee775034cbefea7163a5de', 'message': 'WIP: Migration scenario, SR-IOV vif contains source physical ports

This is not a bug, this is related to future work to support migration for
SR-IOV VMs. In migration scenarios, SR-IOV plug mechanism receives vif and
it proceeds to create vNIC. This fails due to physical ports mismatch. As
there are no physical ports matching with location codes in incoming vif,
no backing device could be created.

This is due to the fact that rebuild logic in nova compute, retrieves vif
details from nova instance and feeds it to plug mechanism. Though neutron
SR-IOV mechanism driver provides new and valid physical ports corresponding
to destination host, it is ignored.

A fix is needed in SR-IOV plug mechanism to retrieve appropriate SR_IOV
physical ports that corresponds to related physical network (from related
neutron network) and consume.

There are two parts to this fix. One is related to physical_network. If
there are no physical network in incoming vif detail, it is retreived using
network id. Refer to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-powervm/+bug/1651129
for a fix on neutron_powervm to avoid this moving forward.

Second part is to retrieve physical ports from the environment using
physical_network against port label attribute.

This is work in progress, UT will be added later. This initial patchset is
to verify the approach.

Change-Id: Ic511314095472da21c3a5588d77955c939b7e0f1
Closes-Bug: #1651147

commit_message:
Migration scenario, SR-IOV vif contains source physical ports

This is not a bug, this is related to future work to support migration for
SR-IOV VMs. In migration scenarios, SR-IOV plug mechanism receives vif and
it proceeds to create vNIC. This fails due to physical ports mismatch. As
there are no physical ports matching with location codes in incoming vif,
no backing device could be created.

This is due to the fact that rebuild logic in nova compute, retrieves vif
details from nova instance and feeds it to plug mechanism. Though neutron
SR-IOV mechanism driver provides new and valid physical ports corresponding
to destination host, it is ignored.

A fix is needed in SR-IOV plug mechanism to retrieve appropriate SR_IOV
physical ports that corresponds to related physical network (from related
neutron network) and consume.

There are two parts to this fix. One is related to physical_network. If
there are no physical network in incoming vif detail, it is retreived using
network id. Refer to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-powervm/+bug/1651129
for a fix on networking-powervm to avoid this moving forward.

Second part is to retrieve physical ports from the environment using
physical_network against port label attribute.

Change-Id: Ic511314095472da21c3a5588d77955c939b7e0f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/74/412474/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import context as ctxfrom nova import network as net_api if not physnet: # Get physnet from neutron network net_id = vif['network']['id'] admin_context = ctx.get_admin_context() napi = net_api.API() network = napi.get(admin_context, net_id) physnet = network.physical_network msys = pvm_ms.System.get(self.adapter)[0] mapping = {} for sriov in msys.asio_config.sriov_adapters: for pport_w in sriov.phys_ports: label = pport_w.label or 'default' if label not in mapping: mapping[label] = [] mapping[label].append(pport_w.loc_code) pports = mapping[physnet]

commit_message:
OpenStackCharm class reset adapters_class to None

The base OpenStackCharm class sets the adapters_class, but unfortunately
in the same function, it then sets it to None.  Although this was the
default behaviour, it was changed so that there was a default
adapters_class.  Unfortunately, this was missed.

This patchset fixes that.

Change-Id: If4e2b1abe33106657f0638179c86c0d619240e98

commit_message:
Deprecate setting IPMI credentials

This feature will be removed from ironic-inspector, so issue a warning
on the client side as well.

Change-Id: I5a09bcc63ee1d704fdda70d50d68dc8bfbb06d1b
Partial-Bug: #1654318

subject: Add Keystone v3 support to charm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-19 11:03:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-tempest/commit/244ab68806714330e779f7ed303015b6562b88dd', 'message': 'Add Keystone v3 support to charm

This change adds Keystone v3 support to the charm. Whether to run
using the keystone v2 or v3 api should be dictated by the
api_version sent down the identity-admin relation but the change
to enable that has not landed yet and it is useful to have this charm
work for v3 against stable charms. To allow this there is some hard
coding of expected v3 credentials that can be removed later. fwiw
this change represents a net reduction in hardcoded creds. changes
include:

1) Fix typo in default floating-network-name ext_net rather that
   ext-net
2) Refactor init_keystone_client to initialise the right client
   depending on api version.
3) Add a keystone_session object which can be shared by the
   individual project clients
4) Use credential information passed down the identity-admin
   relation in the tempest.conf template
5) Disable the ec2 cred checks for keystone v3 as these rely on
   the client being able to resolve users and projects to their
   uuids which does not seem to be possible with a project scoped
   client. This shoud be fixed at a later date by the identity admin
   relation passing the uuids to the charm
6) Remove try/catch-all excepts blocks. They were initially put in
   as the charm tried to render its config as it came up meaning
   that the services it tried to query may have been down. The
   charm no longer does this and a client failure should be fatal.
   Also try/catch-all excepts blocks are a fundamentally bad thing.
   Where needed check that the service is present in the catalogue
   before querying its api.

Change-Id: I3dd5ed610794eece515d9a03391f9844ac83efc0

commit_message:
Add Keystone v3 support to charm

This change adds Keystone v3 support to the charm. Whether to run
using the keystone v2 or v3 api should be dictated by the
api_version sent down the identity-admin relation but the change
to enable that has not landed yet and it is useful to have this charm
work for v3 against stable charms. To allow this there is some hard
coding of expected v3 credentials that can be removed later. fwiw
this change represents a net reduction in hardcoded creds. changes
include:

1) Fix typo in default floating-network-name ext_net rather that
   ext-net
2) Refactor init_keystone_client to initialise the right client
   depending on api version.
3) Add a keystone_session object which can be shared by the
   individual project clients
4) Use credential information passed down the identity-admin
   relation in the tempest.conf template
5) Disable the ec2 cred checks for keystone v3 as these rely on
   the client being able to resolve users and projects to their
   uuids which does not seem to be possible with a project scoped
   client. This shoud be fixed at a later date by the identity admin
   relation passing the uuids to the charm
6) Remove try/catch-all excepts blocks. They were initially put in
   as the charm tried to render its config as it came up meaning
   that the services it tried to query may have been down. The
   charm no longer does this and a client failure should be fatal.
   Also try/catch-all excepts blocks are a fundamentally bad thing.
   Where needed check that the service is present in the catalogue
   before querying its api.

Change-Id: I3dd5ed610794eece515d9a03391f9844ac83efc0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 21:07:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/184a3df46a17bbf720bc2f0277d110a16ecbe495', 'message': "Remove unused short-circuit checks in token provider

The token provider use to have a bunch of short-circuit checks
when rebuilding the token reference. If a value was already present
in the token reference we didn't bother rebuilding it. This logic has
since been removed in favor of always reconstructing the token, which
means we no longer need these checks.

Change-Id: I1f2d1c68a61360fc091d8484a39da20da123599e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused short-circuit checks in token provider

The token provider use to have a bunch of short-circuit checks
when rebuilding the token reference. If a value was already present
in the token reference we didn't bother rebuilding it. This logic has
since been removed in favor of always reconstructing the token, which
means we no longer need these checks.

Change-Id: I1f2d1c68a61360fc091d8484a39da20da123599e

If they have we should # pass them through in the token_data instead of reconstructing them. # In the future we should make *this* class do all that work instead of # relying on whatever individual token providers do... baby steps. if token: for x in ('roles', 'user'):

commit_message:
Forbid creation of cross-domain implied roles

This would otherwise bypass the restriction of not allowing a project
to have a role from a different domain.

Closes-bug: 1657865

Change-Id: Ida6797949f6c10f751c4e1aeeb32f383e33850ed

commit_message:
Improve help text for service options.

This commit adds additional help text to the config
options of the "nova/conf/service.py".

Added choices to strictly check 'network_manager' options
and found a typo in unit test. Fixed it.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: I543e2208b779f9ae3c5c813bba1f93e53c7ca8f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/61/332861/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help=""" Seconds between nodes reporting state to datastore Compute Service must know the status of each compute node to manage them effectively. ServiceGroup driver on each compute node periodically updates their status on database based on the specified report interval. Possible Values: * Any positive integer (in seconds) * 10 seconds(default) Related Options: * service_down_time (report interval should be less than service down time) """), help=""" Enable periodic tasks If set to true, this option allows services to periodically runs tasks on the manager and report its state to the database services table. Possible Values: * True (default), False Related Options: None """), help= """ This option specifies the range of seconds to randomly delay when starting the periodic task scheduler to reduce stampeding. When compute workers are restarted in unison across a cluster, they all end up running the periodic tasks at the same time causing problems for the external services. To mitigate this behavior, periodic_fuzzy_delay option allows you to introduce a random initial delay when starting the periodic task scheduler. Possible Values: * Any positive integer (in seconds) * 0 : disable the random delay * 60 (default) Related Options: * None """), help=""" This option specifies a list of APIs to be enabled by default. Possible Values: * List of APIs * ['osapi_compute', 'metadata'] (default) Related Options: * None """),

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-19 19:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['image-yaml/overcloud-images.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/439d0d5d057258e9950ccc9b356c24a31e833d53', 'message': 'Add the iptables element to the image building process

/etc/sysconfig/iptables and will solve the linked bug where a full

Change-Id: Id0498a1158b5ace0df961248946f3ab5f11c26da

commit_message:
Add the iptables element to the image building process

Adding the iptables element will effectively empty
/etc/sysconfig/iptables and will solve the linked bug where a full
explanation of the different approaches has been provided.

This approach has been chosen because other approaches proved to
be either to complex *or* required that we enable the purging of
rules by default which might be disruptive for existing installations.

Closes-Bug: #1657108
Change-Id: Id0498a1158b5ace0df961248946f3ab5f11c26da
Depends-On: Iddc21316a1a3d42a1a43cbb4b9c178adba8f8db3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/75/422475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

"}, {'number': 35, 'created': '2016-10-14 19:19:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/2f34cb324b5cc4a1fbbd7eb64424a5c054f3419d', 'message': "Implement and Enable Community Images

This change replace the existing boolean 'is_public' column for the
'images' table with 'visibility' enum listing four explicit
visibility values - public, private, shared, and community.

This change also implements and enables all backend code to
utilize the new values.

Change-Id: I94bc7708b291ce37319539e27b3e88c9a17e1a9f

commit_message:
Implement and Enable Community Images

This change replaces the existing boolean 'is_public' column for
the 'images' table with enum 'visibility' column featuring the
four explicit visibility values - public, private, shared,
and community.

This change also implements and enables all backend code to
utilize the new values.

Co-Authored-By: Timothy Symanczyk <timothy_symanczyk@symantec.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dharini Chandrasekar <dharini.chandrasekar@intel.com>

Implements: blueprint community-level-v2-image-sharing
Closes-Bug: #1394299
Closes-Bug: #1452443
Depends-On: I6e3268f3712cbc0aadb51d204c694023b92d55a5
Change-Id: I94bc7708b291ce37319539e27b3e88c9a17e1a9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/10/369110/60 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if (visibility is not None) and (is_public is not None): if (visibility == 'public') and (is_public): pass elif (visibility == 'private') and (not is_public): pass else: # contradictory options, result set must be empty return []
deleted_lines: if 'is_public' in filters: key = 'is_public' value = filters.pop('is_public') prop_filters = _make_image_property_condition(key=key, value=value) prop_conditions.append(prop_filters)

subject: Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 18:45:40.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_keystone_authtoken_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/authtoken_manage_memcache_package-66fdfb8c4204bbe9.yaml', 'manifests/keystone/authtoken.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova/commit/bf469aef5334ad6d004bb97b81e28454937e59a9', 'message': 'Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: I59ddd0cf40f00932355ae626a22ba27dfc6dab22
(cherry picked from commit 0d3fa4f5eb1cc690fe1dcfdc49478bd9b5753672)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: I59ddd0cf40f00932355ae626a22ba27dfc6dab22
(cherry picked from commit 0d3fa4f5eb1cc690fe1dcfdc49478bd9b5753672)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/27/420127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*manage_memcache_package*] # (Optional) Whether to install the python-memcache package. # Defaults to false. # $manage_memcache_package = false, manage_memcache_package => $manage_memcache_package,

subject: Provided an option to disable the password generation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 05:33:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/c1fed0e9317e3ea7890d2080b4ea369f45d2215b', 'message': 'WIP: Provided an option to disable the password generation

Operators may choose to use the passwords provided by them and
does not intend to generate during the deployment. Provided an
option to disable password generation if requested by user explicity.
It will be helpful to identify if there are any new passwords added
which has to be added during the deployment update by the operator.
By default, the password generation will be enabled.

Partial-Bug: #1611704

Change-Id: I141a0727db9f19f80712e2c40069622ecc22d969

commit_message:
Provided an option to disable the password generation

Operators may choose to use the passwords provided by them and
does not intend to generate during the deployment. Provided an
option to disable password generation if requested by user explicity.
It will be helpful to identify if there are any new passwords added
which has to be added during the deployment update by the operator.
By default, the password generation will be enabled.

Partial-Bug: #1611704

Change-Id: I141a0727db9f19f80712e2c40069622ecc22d969

commit_message:
Move nova placement hiera to nova-base

Nova placement hiera parameters need to be common across all nova
services because they are used to more than one place.
This patch moves them to nova-base, so nova-compute and other services
that need it will be able to run correctly.

Change-Id: Ibccc55fc9d045487fb7e47bd1c2ebe9cf788765e
Depends-On: Iada8e9fcccec7dbfe7ac0ec0f9ec6eac1581290e

commit_message:
Limit cluster task cross-dependency on primary-cluster

Cluster task should cross-depend on primary-cluster only if current
node has primary-something role. Otherwise a loop listed in the
referenced bug occurs and deployment breaks.

Also, that CR makes change in rabbitmq networking trigger OpenStack
tasks. That fixes the old assumption that RabbitMQ always lives on
controllers. Now changes in networking of nodes with RabbitMQ role
will also trigger modification of configs for OpenStack services on
other nodes, updating rabbit_hosts parameter.

For the same reason (changes in rabbitmq should trigger OpenStack
tasks) all OpenStack tasks now cross-depend on rabbitmq.

Finally the CR fixes typo in openstack-cinder/tasks.yaml:
cross-depened-by -> cross-dependend-by

Closes-Bug: #1651066

Change-Id: I8b262ef73c9c62ce5a71f0a5eee001b61ba9ecb1

commit_message:
Remove service argument from tempest plugin client manager

It was removed as part of commit
e4be907e34e043888bb10b29655018dd2d4eb06e to tempest.

Also, fix python3 compatibility for API boolean type

This was throwing errors in the latest WSME on python 3.5, make it the
right string type instead. It must be squashed into this change because
each fixes a different CI job, and they can't land without each other.

Closes-Bug: #1654202
Change-Id: I5cefad7d9d8f6db51fd891ecce9879979c83baee
(cherry picked from commit 36bd9235a2334ecc5769d43051c5deeb417e008f)

commit_message:
Move nova::placement to common nova manifest

nova::placement needs to be declared on more than placement api node,
because credentials are used by different services (at least
nova-compute now).
This patch moves the class to base/nova.pp, at the same step.
So compute nodes will have the credentials and will be able to use
Placement API on multinode environments.

Change-Id: Iada8e9fcccec7dbfe7ac0ec0f9ec6eac1581290e

commit_message:
Remove carbonara package reference

carbonara package only had one bin file carbonara-dump.
Thats gone now. Rest of the carbonara code is just python
and part of python-gnocchi. So we dont need this anymore.

Change-Id: I32acaf9edf1632235fd0c98f00caeec98ccd8616

commit_message:
Add debconf translations

  * Added Brazilian Portuguese debconf templates translation (Closes: #850971).
  * Updated German debconf translation (Closes: #842483).

commit_message:
ironic: Have multinode job not use DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX

Have the experimental multinode job not use
DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX. This will cause it to run the tempest
"smoke" test instead. This needs to be done as goal is to get to
running Grenade with multi-node and Grenade requires running tempest
"smoke".

Change-Id: I75760b404eed813a7f9c3f1b899f0779f2c82f95

subject: [Unity driver] VLAN enhancement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 04:35:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/05f654304c07d7fbbba84af074177506bc39dcdc', 'message': '[Unity driver] VLAN enhancement

The enhancement includes:
1. Creates tenant for each vlan on the unity system. So that the nas
server in different vlan will have isolated ip address space.
2. Set network MTU on the unity system

Change-Id: Ic1140112f8cfbed7c89d5f66e6bee0c22d64b3ed
Closes-Bug: 1649458
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-21 10:09:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/39f37f53acd0ee7efba6de957bc0334263a5762c', 'message': '[Unity driver] VLAN enhancement

The enhancement includes:
1. Creates tenant for each vlan on the unity system. So that the nas
server in different vlan will have isolated ip address space.
2. Select the approprite port on the system to create interface based
on MTU.
3. Remove the option emc_nas_server_container to enable the storage
processors load balance and the auto-selection of ports(by mtu).

'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2017-01-16 06:37:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/6c68efbaf7f2daba52de1413ab6e5229e27287be', 'message': '[Unity driver] VLAN enhancement

The enhancement includes:
1. Creates tenant for each vlan on the unity system. So that the nas
server in different vlan will have isolated IP address space.
2. Select the appropriate port on the system to create interface based
on MTU.
3. Remove the option unity_server_container (old emc_nas_server_container)
to enable the storage processors load balance and the auto-selection of
ports (by mtu).

DocImpact

commit_message:
[Unity driver] VLAN enhancement

The enhancement includes:
1. Creates tenant for each vlan on the unity system. So that the nas
server in different vlan will have isolated IP address space.
2. Select the appropriate port on the system to create interface based
on MTU.
3. Remove the option unity_server_container (the old
emc_nas_server_container option) to enable the storage processors load
balance and the auto-selection of ports (by mtu).

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ic1140112f8cfbed7c89d5f66e6bee0c22d64b3ed
Closes-Bug: 1649458

commit_message:
Run aodh-api under mod_wsgi with apache2

This change aligns with the Ocata aodh package, which has
moved the aodh-api to run under mod_wsgi with apache2.

Change-Id: I4aa6a978eb719c955ad216326514d1175c86b4a7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-19 18:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hadoop-cloudera/pre-install.d/10-add-mirror', 'diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh', 'elements/hadoop-cloudera/install.d/50-install-cloudera', 'elements/swift_hadoop/post-install.d/81-add-jar'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements/commit/3dfcb641c0fd9d26cd9f9d39ad9321fea6b1f4ba', 'message': 'Set DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION when required

Set DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION in diskimage-create so that it could not
be an empty value. The order of the lines where DIB_CDH_VERSION is
assigned for other CDH versions where DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION is not
used was changed as well for consistency.
Also, in order to try to prevent future errors, set the value of
DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION based on DIB_CDH_VERSION in all elements where
it is used (thanks to the ${VAR:-value} syntax which does not fail
with set -u even if DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION is not assigned).

Closes-Bug: #1657482
Change-Id: I31b25fd4ba886d051b9b57902cd72349a4a2dbfa
'}]
commit_message:
Set DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION when required

Set DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION in diskimage-create so that it could not
be an empty value. The order of the lines where DIB_CDH_VERSION is
assigned for other CDH versions where DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION is not
used was changed as well for consistency.
Also, in order to try to prevent future errors, set the value of
DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION based on DIB_CDH_VERSION in all elements where
it is used (thanks to the ${VAR:-value} syntax which does not fail
with set -u even if DIB_CDH_MINOR_VERSION is not assigned).

Closes-Bug: #1657482
Change-Id: I31b25fd4ba886d051b9b57902cd72349a4a2dbfa

commit_message:
Bring consistency to tags

Some tags were not applied on the highest level and forced duplication.
We apply here our practices to have role_name-(config|install) [1].

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/openstack-ansible/developer-docs/contribute.html#ansible-style-guide

Change-Id: Idfe109766463dd198d5d64941796617940ef08f9

commit_message:
local.conf support

This attempts to provide local.conf support by making it possible to
have local.conf files during initial processing and concattenating
them to the end of the final local.conf.

This is not fool proof, but given the limited ways that we currently
use configs in devstack-gate, it's good enough to start the
transition.

Change-Id: I3347c0886b1c2c8c56c902f485f45fb126446451

added_lines: function localrc_path { local side=$1 local path if [[ $side == "base" ]]; then path=$BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR elif [[ $side == "target" ]]; then path=$TARGET_DEVSTACK_DIR else die $LINENO "side must be base or target!" fi if [[ -e "$path/local.conf" ]]; then echo "$path/local.conf" else echo "$path/localrc" fi } # if local.conf exists and local.conf.orig does not exist, save local.conf to local.conf.orig if [[ -r $BASE_DEVSTACK_DIR/local.conf && ! commit_message:
Configure Kernel Args and Tuned and then reboot for Compute

* On top of the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/411204
* Added Kernel args and Tune-d configuration
* Added provision to provide different kernel args per role (applicable
  for different types of compute roles only)

Implements: blueprint tuned-nfv-dpdk

Change-Id: I5c538428c376c9d2ebd1c364f0ee8503fd7d620e

commit_message:
Use only Glance V2 by default (with a compatibility option)

Glance V1 is deprecated we should start switching off it. Even more,
some features in Ironic already require V2 anyway.

This change switches everything to V2 by default, while leaving an option
to get previous behavior back. Features that already required V2 are
not affected by this option.

Change-Id: I6947a150fefb7fe3028a0a7c5208c6c343be8e0d
Closes-Bug: #1657475

commit_message:
gnocchi: prepare removal of gnocchi uuid5

This change adds support for the new information within
the UnknownResource exception. But keep support temporary
to the old exception.

Change-Id: I384ca489055201f579e4549371677bff8c3d9ed8

added_lines: gnocchi_data = { 'by-gnocchi-ids': {}, 'by-ceilometer-ids': {} } # returns this id and not the ceilometer one for Gnocchi < 3.1 # We can get rid of gnocchi ids when Ceilometer will depends # on Gnocchi >= 3.1 only m = measures.setdefault(resource_id, {}).setdefault( gnocchi_data['by-gnocchi-id'][gnocchi_id] = res_info gnocchi_data['by-ceilometer-id'][resource_id] = res_info for info in gnocchi_data['by-ceilometer-ids'].values(): is_gnocchi_31_or_later = isinstance(e.message['detail'], list) if is_gnocchi_31_or_later: resource_ids = e.message['detail'].values() resource_infos_by_id = resource_infos['by-ceilometer-id'] else: resource_ids = e.message['detail'] resource_infos_by_id = resource_infos['by-gnocchi-id'] for rid in resource_ids: resource = resource_infos_by_id[rid]['resource'] resource_type = resource_infos_by_id[rid]['resource_type'] del measures[resource['id']]

commit_message:
Add i18n support to Quota.humanizeNumbers

Show localized number format via ECMAScript i18n API.

Closes-Bug: #1384462

Change-Id: Ia8ca3c93c157bfb791f711529d60ce610b3686fe
(cherry picked from commit 89d0304d19e5789bc5b42b30e39e1e71a7f2bdfe)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/90/420790/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe('When the language is changed to "Deutsch (de)"', function() { beforeEach(function() { module('horizon.app'); inject(); horizon.cookies.put("horizon_language", "de"); }); afterEach(function() { horizon.cookies.remove("horizon_language"); }); it('should add a period every three number', function () { expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('1234')).toEqual('1.234'); expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('1234567')).toEqual('1.234.567'); }); it('should work string or numbers', function () { expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('1234')).toEqual('1.234'); expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers(1234)).toEqual('1.234'); }); it('should work with multiple values inside a string', function () { expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('My Total: 1234')).toEqual('My Total: 1.234'); expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('My Total: 1234, His Total: 1234567')).toEqual('My Total: 1.234, His Total: 1.234.567'); }); describe('When the language is changed to "Français (fr)"', function() { beforeEach(function() { module('horizon.app'); inject(); horizon.cookies.put("horizon_language", "fr"); }); afterEach(function() { horizon.cookies.remove("horizon_language"); }); it('should add a no-break space every three number', function () { expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('1234')).toEqual('1 234'); expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('1234567')).toEqual('1 234 567'); }); it('should work string or numbers', function () { expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('1234')).toEqual('1 234'); expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers(1234)).toEqual('1 234'); }); it('should work with multiple values inside a string', function () { expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('My Total: 1234')).toEqual('My Total: 1 234'); expect(horizon.Quota.humanizeNumbers('My Total: 1234, His Total: 1234567')).toEqual('My Total: 1 234, His Total: 1 234 567'); });

commit_message:
Fix a script error which is occurred when choosing no file

In swift container panel, when a user select no file with opening
file select dialog, error will occur because in that case there
are no file info. This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: Ib6e381e9af97837f6aae8df9d9564eee76304670
Closes-Bug: #1636340
(cherry picked from commit 2fbf3fbdf3da2371219da3bc6509e1b622175f5e)

commit_message:
Make evacuate target_host not required

Nova api can auto select target_host to evacuate,
So we should make target_host required=False.

Change-Id: Iff649b0b27a859fa85a985dfd2575e192806c291
Closes-Bug: #1652494
(cherry picked from commit 4c81bc2993c446f187f9e636229e669d5fc974c7)

deleted_lines: help_text=_("Choose a Host to evacuate servers to.")) msg = _('Starting evacuation from %(current)s to %(target)s.') % \ {'current': current_host, 'target': target_host}

commit_message:
Update floating IP tables instance URL check

A port can be given a device owner of 'compute:nova' and associated with
a floating IP; which will fail the current check in the floating IPs
table to attempt to resolve an instance details URL.

This patch updates the condition to actually check for the required variable.

Change-Id: Ic5f78525ba41d47c1a548aeab73933f962343ebd
Closes-bug:  1645683
(cherry picked from commit c1873ea4d9dbe907c3316c24b03db0eb9ea6f694)

commit_message:
Remove carbonara package reference

carbonara package only had one bin file carbonara-dump.
Thats gone now. Rest of the carbonara code is just python
and part of python-gnocchi. So we dont need this anymore.

Change-Id: Iaf1d4b5c85dde30b68d383f43b95d650e43d96a4

subject: Remove all_tenants flag in quota check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-19 16:52:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/access_and_security/floating_ips/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/tests/quotas.py', 'openstack_dashboard/usage/quotas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/62c89a38c06a67e3fc29be3d25f2aead16e80980', 'message': "Remove all_tenants flag in quota check

I don't really know what this was meant to do, but what it actually
does doesn't make any sense -- when checking a quota for project
'foo' we really don't care about how many instances are used
in the entire cloud, only in project 'foo'.

Until Liberty, the all_tenant flag was broken in the nova
api, which probably explains why this was harmless until
Liberty.

Change-Id: I9e12c10951e7518ab1c622a4daac962bad332da5
Closes-Bug: #1610693
(cherry picked from commit d7d59b85969acb757f9871535758d75592aae660)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove all_tenants flag in quota check

I don't really know what this was meant to do, but what it actually
does doesn't make any sense -- when checking a quota for project
'foo' we really don't care about how many instances are used
in the entire cloud, only in project 'foo'.

Until Liberty, the all_tenant flag was broken in the nova
api, which probably explains why this was harmless until
Liberty.

Change-Id: I9e12c10951e7518ab1c622a4daac962bad332da5
Closes-Bug: #1610693
(cherry picked from commit d7d59b85969acb757f9871535758d75592aae660)

commit_message:
Allow definition of repo filename

If a deployer wants to co-locate his rabbitmq mirror with another
content in the same repo, (s)he probably also wants to define the same
repo filename, to avoid clashes.

This commit brings this feature optionally, and follows the same
pattern as other roles.

Change-Id: Id4d2198eebf05a8dc48949e4a129491c75037c79

subject: Fix a bug in process_spawn binding on ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 15:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/cmd/process_spawn.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3a977cd8c242859d56e0ebed56628de5eec2c67b', 'message': "Fix a bug in process_spawn binding on ports

process_spawn module is used in netns-cleanup functional tests. This
module forks processes which will listen on random ports/sockets.
Due to the lack of randomness on how get_free_namespace_port() from
net_helpers was used, all forked processes got the same sequence of
ports to bind on. This led to a race condition and some stayed
alive without actually listening on any port/socket.

Also, the ignore_sigterm feature wasn't handled properly and parent
always died after a SIGTERM which caused the test to fail when the
above condition happened since netns-cleanup wasn't able to find its
parent and kill the process which failed to bind.

Change-Id: I2f6e1f99eae595e3ea8c10998a7ad3c861a694f4
Closes-Bug: #1652124
(cherry picked from commit 55a25bdfaf066523e1faa4e8124e3c1c40add506)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in process_spawn binding on ports

process_spawn module is used in netns-cleanup functional tests. This
module forks processes which will listen on random ports/sockets.
Due to the lack of randomness on how get_free_namespace_port() from
net_helpers was used, all forked processes got the same sequence of
ports to bind on. This led to a race condition and some stayed
alive without actually listening on any port/socket.

Also, the ignore_sigterm feature wasn't handled properly and parent
always died after a SIGTERM which caused the test to fail when the
above condition happened since netns-cleanup wasn't able to find its
parent and kill the process which failed to bind.

Change-Id: I2f6e1f99eae595e3ea8c10998a7ad3c861a694f4
Closes-Bug: #1652124
(cherry picked from commit 55a25bdfaf066523e1faa4e8124e3c1c40add506)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/422053/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random MAX_BIND_RETRIES = 64 # Set a different seed per process to increase randomness random.seed(os.getpid()) # Pick a non privileged port port = random.randint(1024, 65535) handler = ( signal.SIG_IGN if self.ignore_sigterm else self.sigterm_handler) signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, handler)
deleted_lines: from neutron.tests.common import net_helpers MAX_BIND_RETRIES = 5 port = net_helpers.get_free_namespace_port(self.proto) if not self.ignore_sigterm: signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, self.sigterm_handler)

commit_message:
Check for unbound ports in L3 RPC handler

The handler was making the incorrect assumption that once a
host_id was set, a port which failed to bind could only be in
the 'binding_failed' state. So it would not try to rebind ports
that encountered an exeption during port binding commit that left
them in the unbound state.

Change-Id: I28bbeda5fed4275ea38e27308518f89df9ab4eff
Closes-Bug: #1648879
(cherry picked from commit a5a8a37344f6d193886ae8d047664aef76920ed8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/35/422035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: not_bound = port and port.get(portbindings.VIF_TYPE) in ( portbindings.VIF_TYPE_BINDING_FAILED, portbindings.VIF_TYPE_UNBOUND) port.get(portbindings.HOST_ID) != host or not_bound)):

the 'binding_failed' state. So it would not try to rebind ports

commit_message:
Remove iptables nat and mangle rules for security group

There is no need to add iptables nat and mangle rules for security
group, these rules will slow down network performance especially
when using 6wind Virtual Accelerator.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py

Change-Id: I1d5748394665535d114e8d942a68d5bd43927058
Closes-Bug: #1650466
(cherry picked from commit 22352f5d4c595e373bb73c8bc590e6d3e621dac0)

commit_message:
pipeline: remove tests helper from runtime code

cfg_info must not be a dict, so remove the code than handle the
that. This also refactor a bit to remove variable shallowing from
load_config().

The tests now mock the file.

test_unit_identified_source_unit_conversion is now skipped since it
have encoding issue when pipeline is read from a file.

Change-Id: I276607b9836a358d5b183d7097b27cb4cefbd684

commit_message:
Default ironic to not use nested KVM

Nested KVM has many benefits, but when it doesn't work it fails jobs.
This change defaults Ironic to using QEMU emulation, if someone wants
their local devstack to autodetect, they should set
IRONIC_VM_ENGINE="auto", or force KVM by setting
IRONIC_KVM_ENGINE="kvm".

Change-Id: I0367561ead972679250fc48d0f21b2c208e77e60

commit_message:
Manage password_validator with puppet manifest

Horizon provides a password validation check, which OpenStack cloud
operators can use to enforce password complexity checks for users
within horizon.

A dictionary containing a regular expression can be used for
password validation with help text that is displayed if the password
does not pass validation.

HORIZON_CONFIG["password_validator"] = {
   "regex": '.*', ]
   "help_text": _("Your password does not meet the requirements."),
   }

This change allows injection of the regex and help text into horizons
local_settings file.

Change-Id: If82a80ed6a8e6e65aecc2a25ee6d60640ae03c9a
Related-Bug: #1640800

added_lines: features: - Making password_validator a configurable value password_validator allows operators to use a regular express to insure passwords are validated for a certain criterion, which in turn allows stronger security over password complexity

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 02:47:34.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/936b3c3714ce55f8b30f5d7c029577aa61d79843', 'message': "Change order of init _facade and osprofiler

Initialize osprofiler in sqlalchemy/api.py failed with message:

'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_engine'

Re-oder to init osprofiler after _facade will fix this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1657326
"}]
commit_message:
Change order of init _facade and osprofiler

Initialize osprofiler in sqlalchemy/api.py failed with message:

'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_engine'

Re-oder to init osprofiler after _facade will fix this issue.

Change-Id: I420f12f382c4712a692dfa440958b2e497dc22a1
Closes-Bug: #1657326

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 23:37:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/commit/ae97cf1865a35e4f45d0497223a50ff00f5a5603', 'message': 'Fix influxdb statistics list with multiple functions

would be too many rows returned.

The fix is to only append the row once

The test that shows this is fixed is in https://review.openstack.org/417180/.
It is in a separate review because I was fixing the test to work with Vertica
and the corrected test showed up this bug for Influxdb implementation.

Change-Id: Ifbb10f42d7849eb9b36f6bf1f8f8f7fef2940e2e
Closes-Bug: #1656122
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-13 20:11:52.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_api/common/repositories/influxdb/metrics_repository.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/commit/75437f7dde5a963e5927689f1877570b550e9402', 'message': 'Fix influxdb statistics list with multiple functions

If multiple statistic functions were given, for example, max,min, there
would be too many rows returned.

The fix is to only append the row once

The test that shows this is fixed is in https://review.openstack.org/417180/.
It is in a separate review because I was fixing the test to work with Vertica

To get that test to pass, the id has to be set correctly when an offset is

Change-Id: Ifbb10f42d7849eb9b36f6bf1f8f8f7fef2940e2e
Closes-Bug: #1656122
'}]
commit_message:
Fix influxdb statistics list with multiple functions

If multiple statistic functions were given, for example, max,min, there
would be too many rows returned.

The fix is to only append the row once

The test that shows this is fixed is in https://review.openstack.org/417180/.
It is in a separate review because I was fixing the test to work with Vertica
and the corrected test showed up this bug for Influxdb implementation.

To get that test to pass, the id has to be set correctly when an offset is
given. The id has to be the next id, since offset was the id of the last one
returned

Change-Id: Ifbb10f42d7849eb9b36f6bf1f8f8f7fef2940e2e
Closes-Bug: #1656122

commit_message:
Add base profile for Octavia services

Adds initial base profile and profile for API service.

Partially-implements: blueprint octavia-service-integration
Change-Id: I77783029797be4fb488c6e743c51d228eba9c474
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/98/351898/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api # # Octavia API server profile for tripleo # # === Parameters # # [*bootstrap_node*] # (Optional) The hostname of the node responsible for bootstrapping tasks # Defaults to hiera('bootstrap_nodeid') # # [*step*] # (Optional) The current step in deployment. See tripleo-heat-templates # for more details. # Defaults to hiera('step') # class tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api ( $bootstrap_node = hiera('bootstrap_nodeid', undef), $step = hiera('step'), ) { if $::hostname == downcase($bootstrap_node) { $sync_db = true } else { $sync_db = false } include ::tripleo::profile::base::octavia if $step >= 3 and $sync_db { include ::octavia::db::mysql } # We start the Octavia API server on the bootstrap node first, because # it will try to populate tables and we need to make sure this happens # before it starts on other nodes if $step >= 4 and $sync_db { include ::octavia::api # We need to override the hiera value neutron::server::sync_db which is set # to true class { '::octavia::api': sync_db => $sync_db, } } if $step >= 5 and !$sync_db { include ::octavia::api class { '::octavia::api': sync_db => $sync_db, } } }

commit_message:
[UG] Adds filters to the 'fuel2 task list' command

Change-Id: Idab2a7912af7d28f5b79a1aaab4d60f658511fe0
Closes-Bug: #1640224
(cherry picked from commit 0931fcf0a5b745583a73341fb76bb4c28f68836a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/16/422616/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: By default, the :command:`fuel2 task list` shows all deployment tasks. Although, you can filter the tasks in the command output by: * Environment ID: .. code-block:: console fuel2 task list --env <ENV_ID> * Tasks statuses: .. code-block:: console fuel2 task list --statuses ready The available tasks statuses are ``pending``, ``error``, ``ready``, and ``running``. * Tasks names: .. code-block:: console fuel2 task list --names <TASK_NAME>

commit_message:
[UG] Adds filters to the 'fuel2 task list' command

Change-Id: Idab2a7912af7d28f5b79a1aaab4d60f658511fe0
Closes-Bug: #1640224
(cherry picked from commit 0931fcf0a5b745583a73341fb76bb4c28f68836a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/15/422615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: By default, the :command:`fuel2 task list` shows all deployment tasks. Although, you can filter the tasks in the command output by: * Environment ID: .. code-block:: console fuel2 task list --env <ENV_ID> * Tasks statuses: .. code-block:: console fuel2 task list --statuses ready The available tasks statuses are ``pending``, ``error``, ``ready``, and ``running``. * Tasks names: .. code-block:: console fuel2 task list --names <TASK_NAME>
